--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 3/3/03 6:41:10 AM Central Standard Time, 
> cardhead649@y... writes:
> 
> 
> > "I betrayed him?"  Empath has to laugh.  "I suppose so, if you 
can 
> > say that about him keeping me under mind control for 300 years 
before 
> > I broke free.  What good is loyalty to someone who would feed 
dozens 
> > of loyal followers to Unicron just to save his own miserable 
hide?  
> > Hydras only cares about himself.  He wants to rule the universe, 
and 
> > it doesn't matter to him what happens to anyone else along the 
way." 
> 
> She smirked. Only listening for now. 'typical' she thought. It was 
all too 
> familiar. 
>  
> > 
> > Empath digs a little further into Maxima's mind, bringing the 
memory 
> > of that kiss to the forefront.  "If you bought it, he'd only be 
upset 
> > because he lost his newest plaything.  He's using you, Maxima."
> > 
> 
> Stopping for a moment as she stared at Empath. "So much for 
technology. It's 
> not as good as the old Cybertronian technology we were once equiped 
with." 
> then she continued on walking beside Empath. "Obviously. But 
Galvatron did 
> that a lot as well, Empath." Glancing sideways as her. "Or did you 
forget 
> that already?" 
> 
> Continuing to walk in her feline state. "I've noticed much of 
Galvatron in 
> him. However, I'm like Megatron... I belong to no body. I have my 
own 
> objectives. Remember.. the only one I obey & will follow without 
question... 
> is Megatron." Her voice reflected the memories of the painful yet 
joyous 
> past. Then she laughed. "Besides," she smirked," I am not that easy 
to 
> destroy." Living this long, proved that. She always made it 
through, 
> surviving... until the next battle. "If Hydras has any of 
Megatron's 
> memories, then he should know me by now." pausing a 
moment. "Whatever 
> happened between Hydras & I... was a mere fabrication of ... 
organic 
> emotions. Which... I am immune to." she only looked ahead of 
her. "The 
> closest to such organic weaknesses that I have, is my loyalty to 
Megatron." 
> Pausing yet again. "In which I have nearly lost my own functioning 
ability 
> due to someone's foolish desire to depose him. I... getting in the 
way.. to 
> protect him... serve him..." she trailed off.. it was more like she 
was 
> muttering. Why she was 'pouring out her heart' to Empath was 
something she 
> never done. perhaps,.. it was this organic part of her. 
> 
> "Let him try to use me. He'll be greatly disappointed." She 
growled, sounding 
> just like she was in the old days at the beginning of the Great War.

Empath laughs.  "You're as immune to emotions as a wet iron bar is to 
rust," she taunts.  "You'll be sleeping with that egotistical 
scrapheap before you know it."
